sentences.english: The history of superstitious pratices can often help to explain them.
sentences.chinese: 迷信風俗的歷史往往可以用來解釋它本身。

sentences.english: Different people who live in different countries have different customs for eating food.
sentences.chinese: 居住在不同的國家，人民喫的食物與飲食風俗就不同。

sentences.english: Travel will acquaint us with new customs.
sentences.chinese: 旅遊會使我們熟悉新的風俗習慣。

sentences.english: Upon arrival you will have the local kampong style breakfast.
sentences.chinese: 抵達後，體驗富有當地部落風俗的早餐。

sentences.english: End up with custom scenery photography gives me inspiration.
sentences.chinese: 最後得到的風俗風物攝影帶給我的啓示。

sentences.english: For two thousand years, China has always preserved a custom of offering a sacrifice to the kitchen god.
sentences.chinese: 兩千多年來，中國一直保持着祭竈神的風俗。

sentences.english: His followers adopted the custom of wearing a Shamrock on his feast day.
sentences.chinese: 他的追隨者在他的宗教節日採取了佩帶三葉草風俗。

sentences.english: Hence, the custom of hanging lanterns during the lantern Festival came into being.
sentences.chinese: 據說從此以後，就有了元宵掛燈的風俗。

sentences.english: From then on the custom of worshiping the moon spread among the people.
sentences.chinese: 從那時起，敬拜月亮的風俗就在民間流傳開來。

sentences.english: He brought Greek ideas and customs to these people.
sentences.chinese: 他把想法和風俗帶到了希臘人民中。

sentences.english: Since then, the custom of Mid-Autumn Festival worship in private spread.
sentences.chinese: 從此，中秋節拜月的風俗在民間傳開了。

sentences.english: It's our custom to set out a glass of wine on the anniversary of our father's death.
sentences.chinese: 在父親去世一週年的時候敬他一杯酒是我們的風俗。

sentences.english: She told about the custom of the four wines, which existed before the Revolution in Champagne and Bourgogne.
sentences.chinese: 她敘述香檳和勃艮第人獻四道酒的風俗。

sentences.english: Students must respect the habits and customs of China and other countries.
sentences.chinese: 尊重中國人民和他國人民的文化傳統和風俗習慣。

sentences.english: It is a hallmark in Chinese festival celebration to get boozed up.
sentences.chinese: 過節狂飲是中國傳統的風俗之一。

sentences.english: He remained disadapted to their customs and habits.
sentences.chinese: 他仍不適應他們的風俗習慣。

definition: among the people/popular/folk/non-governmental/involving people rather than governments
